summary: The Helping Young Americans Save for Retirement Act aims to amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It primarily focuses on lowering the minimum age for participation in certain pension plans to 18 years old, under specific conditions. This includes adjustments to eligibility requirements and conforming amendments to the relevant sections of the codes. The act also includes considerations for independent audits and the application of these changes to the plan years beginning one year after enactment.
